INGREDIENTS: 
 • 1 cup raw rice
 • 2 tablespoons of whole white urad dal
 • 2 tablespoons butter
 • 1/4 teaspoon cumin seeds/jeera
 • 1/2 teaspoon asafoetida/ hing
 • Salt to taste
 • Oil for deep frying
 • Ice cold water to bind

 METHOD: 

 Preparing the rice flour: 
 1. Soak the rice for 40 minutes, strain the water and dry on a towel. Do not over dry, it must be just dry (slight moisture is essential). Blend into a powder. Once blended sift to get a fine rice flour. The flour must be used immediately to make the Kai Murukku. 

 Preparing the urad flour: 
 1. Roast about 2 tablespoons urad dhal, color should be light golden. Cool and powder immediately. Sift to get fine powder. 

 Preparing the kai murukku dough: 
 1. Add all the dry ingredients including the flour into a large bowl. Add in the butter and ice cold water and knead well to make a soft and smooth dough. Dough should neither be too thick nor too sticky. It should be malleable. 

 Shaping the Kai Murruku,Twirling the dough: 
 1. Divide the dough into lemon sized balls. Keep the dough covered with a wet muslin cloth to avoid drying. Now, oil your fingers especially your fingertips. 
 2. Gently pinch the dough and make it into an elongated shape. Twist and twirl with greased fingers and form a circular pattern of about 4-5 turns, as shown in the image. Place each one of these kai murrukus in a greased plate until you have all ready for frying. 
 3. Preheat the oil for deep frying. Once the oil is hot; slide the murruku from the plate into the hot oil. Fry on medium heat until golden brown in color. Drain and allow it cool. The cooling process makes the murruku crisper. 
 4. Make and serve this delicious Kai Murruku recipe to your family and friends. You can also make this special murruku for diwali festival.
